Job Description -
Microsoft Dynamics Developer
Location: Albany, NY (Must be local) (Hybrid)
Interview: Video
Duration: 12+ months
Job Description
Experience: A minimum of 6 years of related experience.
Ensure the integration of new enhancements with existing systems.
Evaluate configuration changes through deployment and change/release management cycles.
Create documentation for the current system and applied patches.
Provide extended support for post-deployment issues; deliver ongoing maintenance services.
An equivalent combination of advanced education, training, and experience will be considered.

Email:
[email protected]
http://bit.ly/4ey8w48

From:
Ranjay Raj,
flexontechnologies
[email protected]
Reply to:
[email protected]
Role
SAP SD Consultant-- Experience in RAR and iDOC
Location
:
Austin, TX
Duration
: 12+ Months
Implementation Partner
: TCS
End Client:
Apple
Job Description:
SAP SD Required Skills  At least 5 years of experience with SAP projects  Preferred experience in S4 HANA  Solid written and verbal communication skills  Specialized in design and configuration of SAP Sales and Distribution (SD) module  Experience with SAP SD user exits for sales order, delivery, billing etc.  Good knowledge of SD pricing  Understanding of SD account assignment and revenue recognition processes  Ability to debug ABAP  Performing SAP configurations in SAP SD area  Writing of functional/technical specifications for ABAP custom programs and interfaces  Experience with intercompany postings and pro forma invoices  Knowledge of SAP iDocs for order induction  Integration with other SAP modules  Project management experience of SAP projects with integration to external systems and business partners (prior experience with Apple PLC is preferred)  Understanding new business strategies and providing recommendations for automated solutions to support new strategies  Ability to playback designs and system developments to an audience of business users up to 10-20 people  Implementing the proposed solutions with predetermined resources, budget and timelines  Working with business users from all regions to define scope and gather business requirements  Providing conceptual and detailed design to meet business needs  Writing detailed specifications for development of ABAP custom programs  Testing and rollout of the final product  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and work on multiple projects simultaneously  Skilled in working with cross-functional teams Also Must Have  2-3 years of SAP RAR experience Nice to Have  SAP SM Experience
Keywords: sfour South Dakota Texas

BA-Data Analyst- NYC-NY at NYC, New York, USA
Email:
[email protected]
http://bit.ly/4ey8w48
https://jobs.nvoids.com/job_details.jsp?id=2937334&uid=e4d721ebd9ab454eb1a975cc50287f8a
From:
kranthi,
procorpsystems ltd
[email protected]
Reply to:
[email protected]
Responsibilities
Work with business stakeholders to understand data requirements
Collaborate with data architects and analysts to develop and maintain data mapping documentation
Conduct data quality assessments and identify inconsistencies
Perform root cause analysis on any data issues
Support data migration and integration projects
Operate in an Agile product development environment, manage stakeholder requests with clear prioritization, translate complex business needs into technical requirements, and applying a design thinking approach to deliver user-centric, iterative solutions aligned with strategic goals.
Act as a liaison between business and engineering teams to ensure alignment on solution design, delivery timelines, and business outcomes
Participate in sprint planning, backlog refinement, and retrospectives, contributing to iterative development cycles
Create and maintain detailed documentation including user stories, process flows, use cases, and acceptance criteria to support development and testing
Partner with Product and cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with strategic roadmaps, while proactively integrating testing and validation early in the software development lifecycle (SDLC)
Coordinate and support user acceptance testing (UAT), track defects, and ensure timely resolution through collaboration with QA and development teams
Required Skills:
Proven experience as a Data Mapper or in a related role
Proficiency in SQL, Unix CLI, Excel
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proven success in Agile product delivery, stakeholder engagement, and product
development using design thinking to create user-centric financial solutions
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy
3+ years of experience as a business analyst.
Desired Skills
Experience applying Generative AI to enhance analysis and user experience
Dataiku, Tableau, Snowflake
Understanding of data warehousing concepts
Knowledge of data governance and compliance standards
Knowledge of data integration and migration processes
Keywords: quality analyst artificial intelligence

Email:

Position: Oracle Fusion / SaaS/PaaS - Automation and Performance Testing Expert
Location: Plano, TX/ Atlanta. GA / New Jersey (Hybrid)
Duration: Long term
Tax and Treasury apps experience required
Job Summary:
The Automation and Performance Testing Expert is responsible for designing, developing, and executing comprehensive automation and performance test strategies to ensure the quality, scalability, and reliability of software applications. This role involves leading the implementation of test automation frameworks, conducting in-depth performance analysis, and collaborating with development and operations teams to optimize system performance.
Key Responsibilities:
Test Strategy & Planning:
o Define and implement end-to-end automation and performance testing strategies for various applications (e.g., web, mobile, API, cloud).
o Develop detailed test plans, including scope, objectives, resources, and timelines for both automation and performance testing.
o Gather and analyze non-functional requirements (NFRs) related to performance, scalability, and reliability.
Automation Development & Maintenance:
o Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable test automation frameworks and scripts using industry-standard tools (e.g., Selenium, Playwright, Cypress, Appium).
o Implement and integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to support continuous testing.
o Ensure test scripts are maintainable, reusable, and effectively cover critical functionalities.
Performance Testing & Analysis:
o Design and execute various performance tests, including load, stress, endurance, and scalability testing using tools like JMeter, LoadRunner, k6.
o Monitor and analyze system metrics (CPU, memory, disk I/O, network, response times) during performance tests using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Dynatrace.
o Identify performance bottlenecks, conduct root cause analysis, and provide actionable recommendations for performance improvements.
Collaboration & Communication:
o Work closely with development, DevOps, and product teams to align testing efforts with development cycles and business goals.
o Communicate test results, performance insights, and identified issues clearly to stakeholders.
o Mentor and guide junior team members on automation and performance testing best practices.
Continuous Improvement:
o Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies in test automation and performance engineering.
o Drive initiatives to improve testing processes, tools, and methodologies.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., Java, Python, JavaScript).
Expertise in automation testing tools (e.g., Tosca, Selenium, Playwright, Cypress, Appium).
Strong knowledge of performance testing tools (e.g., JMeter, LoadRunner, k6).
Familiarity with monitoring tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, Dynatrace).
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and integration of testing into the development lifecycle.

Email:

Role: Site Reliability Engineer  (Databricks & Snowflake)
Location: Plano, TX/ Atlanta. GA / New Jersey (Hybrid)
Duration: Long term
Dont send DevOps Resumes please
Need Site Reliability Engineer
Job Summary: We are looking for a skilled Site Reliability Engineer with expertise in optimizing Databricks jobs and Snowflake queries. As an SRE, you will play a critical role in ensuring the performance, reliability, and scalability of our data processing systems. You should have a deep understanding of Databricks and Snowflake platforms, with a focus on performance tuning and production support. This role requires a strong grasp of SQL, experience in query optimization, and the ability to conduct regression testing on ETL pipelines post-tuning.
Key Responsibilities:
Analyze Databricks jobs and Snowflake queries to identify performance bottlenecks and inefficiencies.
Develop and implement strategies for optimizing query performance without compromising data integrity.
Collaborate closely with data engineering teams to understand requirements and fine-tune complex SQL queries.
Conduct regression testing on ETL pipelines after query optimizations to ensure consistency and reliability.
Utilize your expertise in Spark to optimize Spark SQL queries running on the Databricks platform.
Monitor system performance metrics and proactively address issues to maintain high availability and reliability.
Document performance improvements, best practices, and guidelines for data processing workflows.
Provide technical support to L2 teams and play a key role in resolving production issues related to performance.
Qualifications:
Proven experience as a Site Reliability Engineer or similar role with a strong focus on Databricks and Snowflake.
In-depth understanding of Databricks architecture, Snowflake data warehousing, and their respective query languages.
Hands-on experience in optimizing SQL queries for performance in large-scale data environments.
Experience with regression testing methodologies for ETL pipelines and data workflows.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Preferred Skills:
Certification in Databricks or Snowflake platforms is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Knowledge of DevOps practices and experience with CI/CD pipelines.

Hi Partner,
NextGen Solutions Corp is a highly recognized provider of professional IT Consulting services in the US.
We are looking for  Certified Technical
project manager to lead the operation and maintenance of an offender management
system. Please note that this position is 100% ONSITE in Washington
DC.
*Client prefers only local candidates to
DC/Maryland/ Virginia (DMV) region *
*No expense reimbursements - please provide
all inclusive rate*
Please click below link to submit onsite to
expedite process. Thank you for your cooperation
is our open requirement which can be filled immediately. Kindly respond to this requirement with your  resume, contact and current location info to speed up the interview process.
Click here to Apply
Job Title
Location
Job Description
Certified Technical Project Manager (Min 10+yrs Exp)(ONSITE_ Only Local to DMV Area)
Washington, DC
Please note that this position is with our direct client
We are looking for a Technical Project Manager (Min 10+ Yrs. Exp) ONSITE (In Person Interview).
POSITION DESCRIPTION
DIRECT CLIENT Position
Number of positions: 1
Length: 12 Months+
Work Address: Washington, DC 20003
Immediate interviews  In Person Interview
Please Note this position is 100% ONSITE Work & ONSITE Interview
Looking for a Sr Technical Project manager
looking for a technical project manager to lead the operation and maintenance of an offender management system.This will include all updates, testing, change management, and support of the current offender management system and upgraded offender management system.
Responsibilities:
1.    Supports development of and applies structured program/ project management standards, approaches, methodologies, tools, and templates to enterprise transformation programs/projects working closely with the Lead Solutions Architect and key stakeholders.
2.    Lead and manage the full project lifecycle, including scope definition, planning, execution, monitoring, and closure.
3.    Solves complex problems with little direction by using knowledge of Government Operations functions.
4.    Drives rigorous program / project planning activities including tactical planning and timeline development.
5.    Integrates project plans and milestones within a defined scope into holistic master plan. identifying gaps and interdependencies.
6.    Manage and monitor cross program or cross-project interdependencies, including integrations with external systems and partners.
7.    Works with senior leadership and project teams to establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPls) of project success. Manages program/ project status reponing process for all in-scope programs/projects and creates senior leadership updates including dashboard and benefit realization reporting.
8.    Proactively identify potential risks, issues, and barriers to execution; develop and implement mitigation strategies and contingency plans.
9.    Facilitate Agile practices such as sprint planning, retrospectives, and stand-ups, ensuring continuous improvement and team alignment.
10. Collaborate with technical teams to ensure adherence to software development best practices, including version control, testing, and release management.
11. Foster a culture of accountability, transparency, and proactive problem-solving across project teams.
12. This position offers limited telework flexibility, subject to project needs and supervisory approval. Successful candidates must be available for on-site work, within a correctional facility.
Qualifications:
1.           6 years experience (Journeyman Mid-Level) in technical project management, delivering complex IT solutions.
2.           6 years of experience managing projects through the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including structured release and change management processes.
3.           Proven experience supporting execution of complex technical projects and / or enterprise in IT transformations.
4.           Demonstrated experience working with multiple levels of highly technical stakeholder (both internal and external).
5.           Demonstrated experience successfully implementing at least one complex project within the last five years. Participated and made significant contributions to at least two additional project implementations within the past 6 years.
6.           Hands-on experience with project management and collaboration tools (e.g., Jira, Azure DevOps, MS Project, Power BI, or equivalent) for dashboards, reporting, and issue tracking.
7.           Strong working knowledge of Agile/SCRUM methodologies and experience facilitating Agile practices in hybrid or multi-team environments.
8.           Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to anticipate and address risks or roadblocks proactively.
9.           Excellent communication, organization, and documentation skills.
10.        PMP, or Certified Scrum Master (CSM) certification preferred.
Required/Desired Skills
Candidates must have ALL the Required skills in order to be considered for the position. Desired or Highly Desired skills are a PLUS but may NOT be required.

Job Title

Job Description
Certified Technical Project Manager (Min 10+yrs Exp)(ONSITE_ Only Local to DMV Area)
Washington, DC
Please note that this position is with our direct client
We are looking for a Technical Project Manager (Min 10+ Yrs. Exp) ONSITE (In Person Interview).
POSITION DESCRIPTION
DIRECT CLIENT Position
Number of positions: 1
Length: 12 Months+
Work Address: Washington, DC 20003
Immediate interviews  In Person Interview
Please Note this position is 100% ONSITE Work & ONSITE Interview
Looking for a Sr Technical Project manager
 looking for a technical project manager to lead the operation and maintenance of an offender management system.This will include all updates, testing, change management, and support of the current offender management system and upgraded offender management system.
Responsibilities:
1.    Supports development of and applies structured program/ project management standards, approaches, methodologies, tools, and templates to enterprise transformation programs/projects working closely with the Lead Solutions Architect and key stakeholders.
2.    Lead and manage the full project lifecycle, including scope definition, planning, execution, monitoring, and closure.
3.    Solves complex problems with little direction by using knowledge of Government Operations functions.
4.    Drives rigorous program / project planning activities including tactical planning and timeline development.
5.    Integrates project plans and milestones within a defined scope into holistic master plan. identifying gaps and interdependencies.
6.    Manage and monitor cross program or cross-project interdependencies, including integrations with external systems and partners.
7.    Works with senior leadership and project teams to establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPls) of project success. Manages program/ project status reponing process for all in-scope programs/projects and creates senior leadership updates including dashboard and benefit realization reporting.
8.    Proactively identify potential risks, issues, and barriers to execution; develop and implement mitigation strategies and contingency plans.
9.    Facilitate Agile practices such as sprint planning, retrospectives, and stand-ups, ensuring continuous improvement and team alignment.
10. Collaborate with technical teams to ensure adherence to software development best practices, including version control, testing, and release management.
11. Foster a culture of accountability, transparency, and proactive problem-solving across project teams.
12. This position offers limited telework flexibility, subject to project needs and supervisory approval. Successful candidates must be available for on-site work, within a correctional facility.
Qualifications:
1.           6 years experience (Journeyman Mid-Level) in technical project management, delivering complex IT solutions.
2.           6 years of experience managing projects through the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including structured release and change management processes.
3.           Proven experience supporting execution of complex technical projects and / or enterprise in IT transformations.
4.           Demonstrated experience working with multiple levels of highly technical stakeholder (both internal and external).
5.           Demonstrated experience successfully implementing at least one complex project within the last five years. Participated and made significant contributions to at least two additional project implementations within the past 6 years.
6.           Hands-on experience with project management and collaboration tools (e.g., Jira, Azure DevOps, MS Project, Power BI, or equivalent) for dashboards, reporting, and issue tracking.
7.           Strong working knowledge of Agile/SCRUM methodologies and experience facilitating Agile practices in hybrid or multi-team environments.
8.           Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to anticipate and address risks or roadblocks proactively.
9.           Excellent communication, organization, and documentation skills.
10.        PMP, or Certified Scrum Master (CSM) certification preferred.
Required/Desired Skills
Candidates must have ALL the Required skills in order to be considered for the position. Desired or Highly Desired skills are a PLUS but may NOT be required.

Position: Oracle Fusion / SaaS/PaaS - Automation and Performance Testing Expert
Location: Plano, TX/ Atlanta. GA / New Jersey (Hybrid)
Duration: Long term
Tax and Treasury apps experience required
Job Summary:
The Automation and Performance Testing Expert is responsible for designing, developing, and executing comprehensive automation and performance test strategies to ensure the quality, scalability, and reliability of software applications. This role involves leading the implementation of test automation frameworks, conducting in-depth performance analysis, and collaborating with development and operations teams to optimize system performance.
Key Responsibilities:
Test Strategy & Planning:
o Define and implement end-to-end automation and performance testing strategies for various applications (e.g., web, mobile, API, cloud).
o Develop detailed test plans, including scope, objectives, resources, and timelines for both automation and performance testing.
o Gather and analyze non-functional requirements (NFRs) related to performance, scalability, and reliability.
Automation Development & Maintenance:
o Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable test automation frameworks and scripts using industry-standard tools (e.g., Selenium, Playwright, Cypress, Appium).
o Implement and integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to support continuous testing.
o Ensure test scripts are maintainable, reusable, and effectively cover critical functionalities.
Performance Testing & Analysis:
o Design and execute various performance tests, including load, stress, endurance, and scalability testing using tools like JMeter, LoadRunner, k6.
o Monitor and analyze system metrics (CPU, memory, disk I/O, network, response times) during performance tests using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Dynatrace.
o Identify performance bottlenecks, conduct root cause analysis, and provide actionable recommendations for performance improvements.
Collaboration & Communication:
o Work closely with development, DevOps, and product teams to align testing efforts with development cycles and business goals.
o Communicate test results, performance insights, and identified issues clearly to stakeholders.
o Mentor and guide junior team members on automation and performance testing best practices.
Continuous Improvement:
o Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies in test automation and performance engineering.
o Drive initiatives to improve testing processes, tools, and methodologies.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., Java, Python, JavaScript).
Expertise in automation testing tools (e.g., Tosca, Selenium, Playwright, Cypress, Appium).
Strong knowledge of performance testing tools (e.g., JMeter, LoadRunner, k6).
Familiarity with monitoring tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, Dynatrace).
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and integration of testing into the development lifecycle.

looking for a Health and Human Services Project Manager
The PM shall serve within the HHS Division with a focus on Strategic Initiatives. The contractor will play a key role across the HHS Division including Strategy, Project Management, and Integration Management. The PM will achieve this by actively owning management of small to mid-sized projects, which may include conducting analyses to solve business problems, and developing strategic business cases, workplans, and/or recommending new operational plans for Business. Additionally, the PM will support the success of the HHS Division by mentoring other team members and developing strong relationships with partners across the District. All duties are to be performed in accordance with the  Program Management Administration policies, practices, and procedures. The PM leads planning and management of small to mid-sized organizational initiatives and activities, including conducting analyses, building business cases, developing project and operational management plans, and driving execution. Supports development of HHS teams to foster collaboration, and effectively conveys and expresses ideas in writing and verbally to individuals and groups, including senior leaders. Develops timelines and detailed workplans to create structure for initiative teams to plan and coordinate activities and resources. Develops recommendations based on data from multiple stakeholders, and leverages data to support and inform timely, effective decisions. Develop, produce, and deliver executive presentations, program updates, and set and articulate goals and timelines to executive leadership.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Responsibilities:
1. Organizes, directs, and manages contract operation support functions, involving multiple, complex, and inter- related project tasks.
2. Manages teams of contract Support Personnel at multiple locations.
3. Maintains and manages the client interface at the senior levels of the client organization.
4. Meets with customer and contractor personnel to formulate and review task plans and deliverable items. Ensures conformance with program task schedules and costs.
Minimum Education/Certification Requirements:
Bachelors degree in Information Technology or related field or equivalent experience
Required/Desired Skills
Candidates must have ALL the Required skills in order to be considered for the position. Desired or Highly Desired skills are a PLUS but may NOT be required.

Job Title: AWS Solutions Architect (Amazon Connect)
Location: Washington, DC  Hybrid Need Local
Interview Mode: Skype
Contract: (Not specified)Position Overview
We are seeking an experienced AWS Solutions Architect with deep hands-on expertise in Amazon Connect to design, implement, and optimize cloud-based contact center solutions. The ideal candidate will be responsible for building intelligent contact flows, integrating AWS services, optimizing reporting, ensuring compliance, and supporting ongoing enhancements. This role requires strong technical capability, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work with cross-functional business and technical teams.Required Qualifications
Bachelors degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent professional experience.
3+ years of hands-on experience with Amazon Connect including contact flow design, routing, reporting, and user management.
Strong practical experience with AWS services including Lambda, DynamoDB, S3, API integrations, and automation.
Experience building conversational experiences using Amazon Lex.
Knowledge of VoIP, telephony concepts, CX (Customer Experience) strategies, and contact center best practices.
Experience with KPI reporting, workforce optimization concepts (forecasting, capacity planning, scheduling), and WFO best practices.
Strong scripting experience (Python preferred).
Proven experience working with cross-functional teams including IT, security, business leaders, analysts, and PMO.
Excellent communication skills for requirements gathering, documentation, and stakeholder engagement.Preferred Qualifications
AWS Certifications (Architect or Developer track)
Experience integrating Amazon Connect with CRM platforms
Experience with other cloud contact center platforms
Knowledge of policy and compliance frameworks related to call centers and enterprise cloud environments
Keywords: sthree information technology

Job Title
Location
Job Description
Business Analyst - Curam  (Min 16+yrs Exp)(REMOTE_ Anywhere in USA)
Washington, DC
Please note that this position is with our direct client
We are looking for Business Analyst - Curam (Min 16+ years of exp)REMOTE (Web Cam Interviews)
POSITION DESCRIPTION
DIRECT CLIENT Position
Number of positions:1
Length: 12Months+
Location: REMOTE
Immediate interviews  Web Cam interviews ONLY
Please Note that this position is Remote.
16+ years of experience. Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on both user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems and industry requirements.
Requirement Description
The contractor shall be customer service oriented, have strong team and interpersonal skills, and ability to multi-task when required. Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills are a mandatory requirement. As a Business Analyst (Curam), you will be responsible for assessing current challenges, partnering with leadership to help develop strategic plans and initiatives to address priorities, identifying change opportunities and recommending supporting initiatives, planning and leading workshops for gap analysis and training sessions. The Analyst will be required to analyze, validate and support implementation of requirements for  projects from inception to conclusion. Evaluate current processes and recommend areas for improvement, optimization, development and or maintenance through analyzing system performance, known system issues, existing documentation, and supporting technology related to business processes. The incumbent will become an integral part of the  Team, making every problem associated to the platform a problem of their own and will demonstrate the required initiative and critical thinking abilities necessary to resolve all problems and challenges accordingly.
Behavior Characteristics
Adaptable
Analytical
Goal-Orientated/Driven/Self-Starter
JOB DESCRIPTION
Responsibilities:
1. Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on both user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems and industry requirements.
2. Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operation time, and form of desired results. Includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into proper system requirements specifications.
3. Provides consultation on complex projects and is considered to be the top level contributor/specialist of most phases of systems analysis, while considering the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment.
Minimum Education/Certification Requirements :
Bachelors degree in Information Technology or related field or equivalent experience; or a current Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification
Required/Desired Skills
Candidates must have ALL the Required skills in order to be considered for the position. Desired or Highly Desired skills are a PLUS but may NOT be required.

Hi,
I hope this email finds you well.
My name is Shubham, and I am a Technical Recruiter from Empower Professionals Inc. We are sourcing
ESM ServiceNow Service Management Office (SMO) Business Analyst
role with one of our clients at location 100 % Remote. Please let me know if you are available in the job market and interested in this role (see the jobs description below) - if so, we can connect and speak further.
Please share your updated resume with the current location and work authorization.
Role: ESM ServiceNow Service Management Office (SMO) Business Analyst
Locations: 100% Remote
Duration: 12+ Months Contract
Job Description:
The SMO Business Analyst acts as a bridge between business stakeholders and the Service Management Office, ensuring that service management processes, tools, and governance frameworks meet organizational needs.
This role focuses on gathering requirements, analysing data, and supporting the design and implementation of ITSM/ESM solutions aligned with ITIL and SIAM principles.
Responsibilities:
Requirements Gathering & Analysis:
Work with stakeholders to capture business needs for ITSM and ESM processes.
Document functional and non-functional requirements for SMO initiatives.
Process Design Support:
Assist in mapping current and future state service management processes.
Identify gaps and recommend improvements for ITIL-aligned workflows.
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Analyze service performance metrics, SLAs, and KPIs.
Prepare dashboards and reports for governance meetings.
Tool Enablement:
Support configuration and testing of ITSM platforms (e.g., ServiceNow).
Validate integrations and data consistency across systems.
Governance & Compliance:
Ensure adherence to SMO standards and regulatory requirements.
Maintain documentation for audits and process reviews.
Stakeholder Communication:
Facilitate workshops, create user stories, and manage backlog for SMO projects.
Act as liaison between technical teams and business units.
Qualifications:
35 years as a Business Analyst in ITSM/ESM environments.
Familiarity with ITIL processes and service management frameworks.
Technical Skills
Knowledge of ITSM tools (ServiceNow preferred).
Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools (Excel, Power BI).
Certifications
ITIL Foundation
ServiceNow Fundamentals
ServiceNow Certified System Administrator
Soft Skills
Strong analytical and documentation skills.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement abilities.
Experience with SIAM models and multi-vendor environments.
Exposure to Agile methodologies and backlog management.
Understanding of AI-driven ITSM capabilities and automation trends.
Thanks
Shubham

Job Title : Boomi Lead Engineer
Location : Goleta CA (Onsite)
Job Description:
Key Responsibilities
Support the existing integration landscape composing of technologies like Rust on AWS, Oracle SOA and Boomi.
Work on support ticket related to integrations.
Translate business capabilities and nonfunctional requirements (NFRs) into integration patterns (pub/sub, request/response, batch/streaming, event-driven, CDC, async messaging).
Establish API-first design, REST/GraphQL, versioning strategy, schema governance, and SLAs/SLOs.
Create canonical data models and mapping standards.
drive reuse via common connectors, templates, and accelerators.
Implement coding standards, peer reviews, and automated testing (unit, integration, contract tests) for processes and APIs.
Architect trading-partner integrations (AS2/SFTP/HTTPS), standards (X12/EDIFACT), and functional acknowledgements.
Required Skills & Experience
8 years working with production grade Integration platforms with at least 4 years hands-on on Boomi Integration.
Proven delivery of complex, multi-system integrations in retail domain.
Deep knowledge of integration patterns (EIP), API lifecycle, microservices, and event-driven design.
Expertise with Boomi components: Processes, Connectors, Process Routes, Decision/Branching, Document Caching, Process Reporting, Schedules, API Management, B2B/EDI, MDM,Flow.
Strong skills in JSON/XML/XSD/XPath/XSLT, SQL, and scripting (Groovy/JS) within Boomi contexts.
Strong knowledge of CI/CD practices and tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI) Excellent communication and stakeholder management.

job_description:
Home
H1b Local only :: SDET Engineer (UI Testing) :: O Fallon , MO - Onsite at Fallon, Nevada, USA
Email:
[email protected]
http://bit.ly/4ey8w48
https://jobs.nvoids.com/job_details.jsp?id=2937303&uid=23b0618eefdc41948f8135d807af2e2f
From:
Yash Chaudhary,
Keyinfotek
[email protected]
Reply to:
[email protected]
Job Tittle : SDET Engineer (UI Testing)
Location : O Fallon , MO - Onsite
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain UI test automation frameworks using tools such as Selenium, Playwright, Cypress, or WebDriverIO.
Create, execute, and maintain automated test scripts for web and mobile applications.
Collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and manual QA engineers to understand requirements and ensure test coverage.
Implement and maintain CI/CD integration for automated test execution (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps).
Perform cross-browser and cross-platform testing to ensure consistent UI behavior.
Identify, report, and track bugs; analyze root causes and assist in defect resolution.
Develop and execute performance and regression testing as needed.
Contribute to test strategy, test data management, and test environment setup.
Mentor team members on automation best practices and coding standards.
Required Qualifications
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
3+ years of experience as an SDET or QA Automation Engineer focusing on UI testing.
Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, or C#.
Hands-on experience with Selenium, Playwright, or Cypress for web automation.
Familiarity with page object model (POM), data-driven, or keyword-driven test design patterns.
Experience with API testing tools (e.g., Postman, RestAssured) is a plus.
Strong understanding of SDLC, STLC, and Agile methodologies.
Experience with version control systems (Git) and CI/CD tools.
Regards,
Yash Chaudhary
Lead Technical Recruiter
KEY INFOTEK LLC

[email protected]
https://keyinfotek.com/

Local candidate only

Still looking for a VERY EXPERIENCED 100% ONSITE PLATFORM ENGINEER CONTRACTOR (INFRASTRUCTURE DEVOPS) -- ONLY CANDIDATES LOCAL TO IL OR WI!!!
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES
As a Platform Engineer youll support the creation and maintenance of our enterprise platform solutions.
Plan, automate and deploy the platforms that support enterprise microservices.
Build and maintain secure, efficient CI/CD pipelines and automated testing workflows.
Own and support the software packages you manage, with a strong focus on reliability and performance.
Monitor and continuously optimize platform health and security.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related field.
10+ years of experience with container orchestration tools such as Kubernetes, OpenShift or Docker Swarm.
10+ years of hands-on experience with DevSecOps tools like JFrog Xray, SonarQube and Red Hat ACS, or similar.
Kubestronaut certification is PREFERRED.
Strong understanding of network, DNS and security fundamentals.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and COMMUNICATION SKILLS.

Title: Kafka Architect
Location: Chicago, IL(Hybrid Onsite)(Local only)
Duration: 6 months C2H
IV: Phone and Video
Visa: USC or GC only
The Senior Confluent Kafka Architect is a key position within the Data Management team. The primary responsibility of this role will be to design, implement and manage complex data streaming architectures using Apache Kafka and Confluent technologies.
What Youll Do
Lead the solution design and implementation of robust data-led integration architectures using Confluent Kafka, NoSQL databases, and SQL Server Data Warehouse ensuring scalability, performance, and strong security.
Design and implement data streaming pipelines using Kafka and its ecosystem.
Architecting and designing for a ground-up build of a Confluent Kafka platform for the enterprise.
Diagnose and resolve issues related to Kafka Implementations and assist in estimation and scoping of all Kafka implementations.
Ensure data quality and consistency across streaming data pipelines.
Implement security best practices for Kafka, including authentication, authorization, and encryption.
Lead onshore/offshore team members.
Qualifications
Bachelors degree with 7+ years experience or masters degree with 5+ years experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or other quantitative fields.
5+ years of experience as a data engineer, with a focus on Kafka and streaming technologies and leading complex Kafka implementation projects with minimum 2+ hands-on experience with Confluent Kafka Platform.
At least 3 years of architectural experience with Kafka, having successfully led streaming solutions for multiple enterprise initiatives including offset management, partition strategy, and DR requirements
Expertise in designing and developing real-time stream processing applications using Kafka Streams/kSQL. Strong experience in designing, building, and configuring Kafka event clients, brokers, topics, producers, consumers.
Strong experience with using Kafka Connect to build connectors that facilitate data movement between Kafka and other systems. Experience with designing and creating end-to-end streaming data pipelines, where data is ingested, processed, and stored in real-time, ensuring data consistency and latency requirements.
Thanks & Regards!

Title:- Workday Learning Consultant
Location: Remote / Fremont  California
Mode :- Contract || Long Term
Job Overview:
Workday Learning Consultant will work directly with internal stakeholders to develop, deploy, and support learning campaigns and associated reports to ensure company compliance.
Job Description:
Set up and maintain the Workday Learning module, including creating and managing learning content (courses, lessons, programs), scheduling learning campaigns, and managing user access.
Stay up to date on new features in Workday Learning, including biannual releases.
Develop test cases for Workday Learning updates, upgrades, and enhancements, as well as troubleshooting user issues and system errors.
Partner with the HRIS team on system integrations with third party content providers.
Providing support to users on the Workday Learning module, including training materials, documentation, and troubleshooting assistance.
Manage learning data within Workday, ensuring data accuracy and generating reports to track learning progress and effectiveness.
Monitor assignment, enrolment and completion of compliance courses for new joiners as well as annual learners.
Ensure data privacy and integrity at all times.
Skills / Knowledge:
Strong knowledge of the Workday Learning module, including its configuration, functionality, and best practices
Solid understanding of HR systems, functions, processes, and advanced reporting environments
Strong experience in iloads, EIBs and Core Connectors
Analytical skills and ability to synthesize change quickly using subject and process knowledge.
Independent problem solving  ability to articulate issues across projects and the business.
Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Experience:
6+ years of experience with Workday Learning and core HCM
Experience with Workday Custom Report writing (Advanced, Matrix, Composite, RaaS, etc.) including the development of complex calculated fields
Preferred experience with Workday PRISM
Workday Learning Certification
Thanks and Regards

Role: Azure Devops Architect
Experience: 12+ years Experience Mandatory
Location:
Chicago - IL (Onsite)
Top 3 skills required for this role:
1. Azure Architecture
2. Terraforms
3. Github CICD
Qualifications :
- Possess a strong background in Azure Architecture with hands-on experience in designing and deploying cloud solutions.
- Demonstrate proficiency in using Terraform for infrastructure automation and management.
- Have experience with Azure DevOps for continuous integration and continuous deployment processes.
- Exhibit excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken, for effective collaboration.
- Show a deep understanding of hybrid work models and their application in cloud environments.
- Display problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues.
- Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends to maintain a competitive edge.
Job Description/ Responsibilities
- Design and implement scalable Azure architecture solutions to meet business needs and enhance operational efficiency.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate Azure services and ensure seamless deployment processes.
- Develop and maintain infrastructure as code using Terraform to automate provisioning and management of cloud resources.
- Oversee Azure DevOps pipelines to streamline application development, testing, and deployment processes.
- Provide technical guidance and support to development teams to ensure best practices in cloud architecture.
- Monitor and optimize cloud infrastructure for performance, cost, and security, ensuring compliance with industry standards.
- Conduct regular assessments and audits of cloud environments to identify and mitigate potential risks.
- Lead efforts in troubleshooting and resolving complex technical issues related to Azure services and infrastructure.
- Stay updated with the latest Azure technologies and trends to drive innovation and continuous improvement.
- Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective cloud solutions.
- Ensure documentation of architecture designs, processes, and procedures for knowledge sharing and future reference.
- Facilitate training sessions and workshops to enhance team knowledge and skills in Azure technologies.
- Contribute to the companys strategic goals by leveraging cloud solutions to drive business growth and societal impact.

location: Denver CO We are seeking an experienced AWS Senior Architect to lead the implementation of an AIOps framework, leveraging AWS
job_description:
Home
AWS Solution Architect with AI/ML at Remote, Remote, USA
Email:
[email protected]
http://bit.ly/4ey8w48
https://jobs.nvoids.com/job_details.jsp?id=2937291&uid=1453b8db3fa14705850633343e746fce
Role: AWS Solution Architect with AI/ML
Experience: 15 Years
Visa: USC/GC/H1B
Location: Denver CO
We are seeking an experienced AWS Senior Architect to lead the implementation of an
AIOps framework, leveraging AWS's latest AI technologies, including Amazon Bedrock,
Amazon Neptune, Amazon GNN, and AI agentic layers and frameworks, to optimize our
network technology services.
Job Summary: As the AWS Senior Architect, you will be responsible for designing and
implementing an AIOps framework tailored for our telecommunications network
services. You will utilize AWS's AI technologies and ANO capabilities to enhance
network performance, predict and prevent outages, and automate network operations.
This role requires a deep understanding of AWS cloud services, AI/ML solutions, and
the telecom industry's unique challenges.
Key Responsibilities:
1\. AIOps Framework Development:
o Design and implement an AIOps framework using AWS AI technologies to
automate and enhance network operations.
o Integrate machine learning models to predict network outages and
optimize performance.
2\. AWS Architecture Design:
o Develop scalable and reliable AWS cloud architecture that supports AIOps
initiatives.
o Incorporate Amazon Bedrock for foundational AI models and Amazon
Neptune for graph database solutions.
o Utilize Amazon GNN for graph neural network applications in network
topologies.
3\. Agentic AI Integration:
o Implement AWS AI agentic layers and frameworks to facilitate
autonomous decision-making processes within network operations.
4\. Collaboration and Leadership:
o Work closely with cross-functional teams, including network engineers,
data scientists, and operations, to implement AIOps solutions.
o Lead technical discussions and workshops to drive AIOps adoption.
5\. Technology Evaluation and Implementation:
o Evaluate and incorporate AWS AI services such as SageMaker,
Rekognition, and Comprehend into network operations.
o Leverage AWS's ANO capabilities to automate network monitoring and
management.
6\. Continuous Improvement:
o Implement feedback mechanisms to continuously improve the AIOps
framework.
o Stay updated with AWS's latest offerings and advancements in AI and
network technologies.
Qualifications:
Education:
o Bachelor's or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information
Technology, or a related field.
Experience:
o Minimum of 8 years of experience in cloud architecture, with a focus on
AWS.
o Proven experience in implementing AI/ML solutions in a telecom
environment.
Technical Skills:
o Expertise in AWS services such as EC2, S3, Lambda, SageMaker,
CloudFormation, Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Neptune, and Amazon GNN.
o Strong understanding of AI/ML concepts and tools, including agentic AI
frameworks.
o Familiarity with telecom network technologies and protocols.
Soft Skills:
o Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
o Strong communication and leadership abilities.
o Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional or similar certification.
Experience with DevOps practices and tools.
Knowledge of network automation tools and frameworks.

This is PREMA from Reveille Technologies. We are looking for  Training Lead  SAP S/4HANA Implementation the below mentioned job description. Kindly forward me your resume, Rate and contact details for further process. I also request you to forward this opportunity to your friends or colleagues; so that we can help someone who may be in search of a job or looking for a change.
Role : Training Lead  SAP S/4HANA Implementation
Location: Houston, TX - Day 1 On-site  Local Only
Exp: 10+ Years
Skills: S/4HANA program, logistics, LMS coordination
Job Description:
The Training Lead oversees the end-to-end learning strategy and execution for the S/4HANA program, ensuring that business users are equipped with the knowledge and skills needed to adopt the new system and processes.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop the training strategy, plan, and curriculum for all S/4HANA workstreams.
Identify training needs based on process changes and role-based requirements.
Coordinate creation of training materials (work instructions, simulations, job aids).
Lead scheduling and delivery of instructor-led, virtual, and e-learning sessions.
Manage training logistics, LMS coordination, and user attendance tracking.
Measure training effectiveness and drive reinforcement activities to ensure adoption.
Warm Regards,

Dear Candidates,
Please find the below JD for the role of Sr. Data System Analyst
Position: Sr. Data System Analyst
Location : Dallas TX or Florham Park, NJ (3 Days onsite)
Note : Wealth Management background is needed with the strong 10+ Years of experience.
Job Summary:
We are looking for a highly skilled
Senior
Data
/System
Analyst
to join our
Data Engineering team
,
where you'll play a pivotal role in designing, analyzing, and
optimizing data systems and pipelines. You will act as the bridge
between business stakeholders, data engineers, and
architectstranslating business
data
needs into scalable technical
data
solutions. This role demands a deep understanding of
wealth management
data
domain,
operational
data
processing
, system integration, and agile delivery practices.
Key Responsibilities:
Analysis & Design
Analyze
large datasets to identify trends, patterns,
and translate them into technical specifications for data engineering solutions.
(e.g. API Swagger
Document, Data Lineage Document
)
Design and document data flows, system interfaces, and integration points across platforms.
Create test cases and assist unit or integration testing to ensure code quality.
Support the development and maintenance of real-time
and batch
data pipelines.
Ensure alignment with architecture and data governance standards.
Stakeholder Engagement
Collaborate with product owners, business analysts, and data consumers to understand data needs
, data quality rules and data reconciliation actions
Facilitate workshops, requirement-gathering sessions, and technical walkthroughs.
Act as a liaison between technical teams and non-technical stakeholders to ensure clarity and alignment.
Quality & Delivery
Define acceptance criteria and validate deliverables against
data requirements
Support testing, troubleshooting, and deployment of data solutions.
Contribute to sprint planning, backlog grooming, and agile ceremonies.
Qualifications:
Bachelors or masters
degree in computer science
, Information Systems, or related field.
5+ years of experience in systems analysis, preferably within data engineering
in the Wealth Management domain.
Strong understanding of
operational
data
store practices, data mastering
, ETL/ELT processes,
AWS
cloud platform
, and API.
Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with
Cloud
technologies (e.g.,
Iceberg, DynamoDB
, Snowflake).
Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies and tools like Jira
Excellent communication, documentation, and stakeholder management skills.
Experience with data modeling and metadata management.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
Knowledge of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and compliance frameworks.
Regards,
Garvit
KayCee Tech Solutions INC
81 Culver Avenue
Jersey City ,NJ 07305
Email
[email protected]

Federal client
Cloud Database Admin / ETL Engineer
Location: Everett, MA (Hybrid  Locals Needed, Mostly Remote)
Hours: 37.5 hrs/week | Multi-Year Contract
Were looking for a Cloud DBA / ETL Engineer to help modernize a large state data environment  migrating legacy SSIS pipelines, tuning cloud databases, and building scalable data pipelines on AWS. If youre strong with Oracle RDS, SQL, Airflow, AWS, and ETL migration, this role is a strong fit.
Key Skills Needed (Must-Have)
Oracle RDS (AWS)
Advanced SQL + PL/SQL with experience translating to Snowflake/Postgres
AWS data tools: S3, DMS, MWAA/Airflow
SSIS to SQL-based ETL migration
Airflow DAG creation, scheduling, and dependency management
Data warehouse concepts (SCD, facts, dimensions, CDC)
Python or Bash scripting
GitHub and Jira experience
Nice-to-Haves
Snowflake (Snowpipe, RBAC, Time Travel)
Kafka or similar CDC tools
State or federal government experience
Education domain background
What Youll Do
Manage and optimize cloud-native databases (Oracle, Postgres, Snowflake)
Migrate legacy SSIS ETL to modern SQL + Airflow pipelines
Build Airflow scheduling and dependency frameworks
Tune SQL performance and improve high availability
Implement PII/FERPA security compliance (encryption, masking, audits)
Collaborate with cloud engineers and data teams to modernize the data stack

Job Description -
Job Title: Securities Lending Front Office Developer
This contract has an initial duration of six months with likely extension  could convert to FT after 6 months
Key skills:  Java, Securities Lending, Lending Platform experience (like FIS (Loanet/Loanex) or Global One), BTCC, some sort of AI platform like DL4J is a plus, Murex is also a plus
Really need more of a front office type of person (i.e., working with traders)
Local candidates strongly preferred, interview will be f-f for final round (after 2-3 video rounds, will likely have a coding test)
Required Skills
Hands-on experience in Java in Securities Lending development space.
In-depth knowledge of Securities Lending platforms experience (like FIS (Loanet/Loanex) or Global One)
Experience with mission-critical trading platforms (Order/Stock Loan/Market Data Systems)
BTCC experience
Direct collaboration with trading desks, quants, and risk teams
Expertise in DevSecOps methodologies and tools such as Jenkins, Ansible, PuppetLabs, SonaType, SonarQube, Tenable, Invicti and Zero Networks
Experience in development and maintenance of automated testing frameworks
Solid understanding of back-end and front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Bachelors/masters degree in computer science or related field
5+ years of Java development experience, ideally in capital markets/financial services
Experience with frameworks (Spring, Hibernate), messaging (Kafka, RabbitMQ), and databases (Oracle, SQL Server, Snowflake)
Proficiency with Git and Agile development
Strong multitasking, organizational, and communication skills
Good to Have
Experience with AI/ML
Experience and familiarity with Log observability tools such as Elastic Search/Kibana/Splunk stack.
Familiarity with pricing models, quantitative analysis, and P&L calculations.
Experience with leading industry platforms, including Quod, FlexTrade, Charles River Trader, Nuvoprime, and Murex.
Experience with cloud (Azure, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes)
Knowledge of regulatory/risk/compliance and audit controls in Securities Lending space is plus.
Keywords: artificial intelligence machine learning

Hiring candidates local to Austin, TX for Java Backend Developer with Agentic workflow:: Austin, TX at Austin, Texas, USA

https://jobs.nvoids.com/job_details.jsp?id=2937265&uid=c32386533fe741db8edb1da35dd6e578
Java Backend Engineer  Agentic Worflows (Austin)
Job Summary
We are seeking a highly skilled Java Backend Engineer with expertise in agentic workflows and MCP (Model Context Protocol) service integration to join our engineering team. The ideal candidate will design, develop, and optimize backend systems that power intelligent, autonomous agents and context-driven services. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to architect scalable solutions that leverage cutting-edge AI workflows while maintaining reliability, performance, and security.
Location: Austin,TX
Years of experience needed
7 + years of experience in Java Backend development exposure to Agentic workflows
Required skills:
Bachelors/masters degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field.
5+ years of backend engineering experience with strong expertise in Java (Java 11+) and Python.
Proven experience with agentic workflows (autonomous task orchestration, tool use, context-driven execution).
Hands-on with MCP (Model Context Protocol) service development and integration.
Strong understanding of microservices architecture, RESTful APIs, gRPC, and message queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc.).
Experience with databases (SQL & NoSQL) and caching solutions (Redis, Memcached).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
Solid grasp of concurrency, multithreading, and distributed systems design.
Proficiency in CI/CD pipelines, testing frameworks (JUnit, Mockito), and code quality tools.
Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain scalable Java-based backend services to support agentic workflows and AI-driven applications.
Implement and optimize MCP services to enable seamless context sharing and dynamic orchestration between models, agents, and tools.
Architect APIs, microservices, and event-driven systems that ensure high performance, reliability, and low-latency communication.
Collaborate with data scientists, AI/ML engineers, and frontend developers to integrate agentic intelligence into production systems.
Write clean, maintainable, and testable code while following best practices in software engineering.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize system performance, scalability, and fault-tolerance.
Contribute to workflow automation, context management, and intelligent decision-making systems.
Stay up to date with emerging technologies in AI, distributed systems, and backend engineering
Preferred Qualification:
Experience with AI/ML infrastructure, LLM-based applications, or agent frameworks.
Knowledge of event sourcing, CQRS, and workflow engines (e.g., Temporal, Camunda, Airflow).
Contributions to open-source projects related to agentic systems or MCP.
Understanding of observability (logging, tracing, metrics) in distributed systems.
Behavioral Skills:
Excellent Communication skills and collaboration skills
Ability to propose and implement improvements in the system
Ability to work with cross-functional stakeholders

Email:
[email protected]
http://bit.ly/4ey8w48
https://jobs.nvoids.com/job_details.jsp?id=2937260&uid=3c5e1b44a41a4b3e975dc1c64e6da3eb
Job Title:  SAP EDI Specialist
Duration:
6 months
Location:
Remote
GC/USC
Rate - &75/hr.c2c
Primary Skills:  EDI, SAP
Secondary Skills:
Description:
The
EDI Specialist is responsible for establishing, monitoring and maintaining
integration between client's internal enterprise application (SAP) and external
suppliers and customers, via a Cloud-based EDI solution hosted by a
managed-services provider. In addition to providing world-class support to a
globally diverse customer and trading partner base, the employee will
independently lead initiatives to establish new connectivity and integration
with applications and trading partners using a variety of EDI standards. The
specialist will also build foundational expertise in API-led integration and
AI-driven automation, by enabling real-time, scalable, and intelligent data
flows with suppliers and customers.
Responsibilities:
Monitor daily integration processes across EDI protocols, SAP IDoc interfaces,
and related ports, ensuring timely error resolution.
Collaborate with internal teams and the EDI managed services partner to analyze
and resolve integration issues using monitoring tools and SAP. Internal teams
include IT&SAP specialists, sales admin & customer service, shipping,
finance, purchasing and production planning teams.
Provide support across application-to-application and business-to-business
integration technologies.
Manage relationships with trading partner EDI coordinators to ensure smooth
communication and issue resolution.
Negotiate project scope, timelines, and delivery schedules with internal teams
and external partners.Monitor daily integration processes and resolve errors
timely. Integration scope includes a multitude of EDI protocols, SAP idocs
interface and related ports, and possibly other application to application and
business to business integration technologies.
Coordinate and deliver EDI change requests in alignment with business needs.
Lead project planning sessions with customers, business analysts, and team
members to define and analyze business requirements.
Adhere to standard IT procedures and compliance practices.
Provide guidance to the managed services partner on EDI mapping specifications.
Prepare functional specifications, test plans, user documentation, technical
integration documentation, and control plans.
Prepare and execute integration test plans, ensuring robust test environments
and accurate simulated EDI test data.
Coordinate and execute testing activities with the managed services partner.
Regards,
Sandy M

SAP Ariba Contracts Lead
Interview Process: 2 rounds
Work schedule details: Remote
Location: Must sit in California
Candidate will have to go to LIVE SCAN IN CALIFORNIA BEFORE OFFICIAL ONBOARDING.
Required Skills:
SAP Ariba
SAP Ariba Contracts
Requirements for the SAP Ariba Contracts Lead:
Proven experience implementing SAP Ariba Contracts, including responsibilities in requirements gathering, configuration, and deployment.
Demonstrated ability to configure contract templates, clause libraries, or workflows in SAP Ariba to support procurement or legal processes.
Experience leading complex SAP Ariba Contracts projects with a focus on user adoption and change management.
SAP Ariba Certification is preferred; SAP S/4HANA experience is also preferred.
Ability to sit in California and attend a mandatory live scan fingerprinting process before onboarding.
Responsibilities:
Lead end-to-end SAP Ariba Contracts implementations, including requirements gathering, solution design, configuration, testing, and deployment of contract management functionalities.
Drive contract creation, negotiation, approval, and lifecycle management using SAP Ariba solutions to support compliance, risk mitigation, and organizational policy alignment.
Configure and optimize contract templates, clause libraries, and workflow processes, ensuring seamless integration with procurement, legal, and other cross-functional teams.
Serve as a key champion for user adoptionconducting training sessions, supporting change management initiatives, and enhancing overall proficiency with Ariba Contracts across business units.
Monitor contract performance, analytics, and compliance metrics, delivering insights and recommendations to drive continuous process improvement and maximize value realization.
SAP Ariba Certification is preferred; SAP S/4HANA experience is also preferred.
Expected Deliverables:
Functional Specifications
Configuration Documentation

Hello
My name is Shubham, and I am a Recruitment lead at Sureminds Solution. I am reaching out to you on an exciting job opportunity with one of our clients.
Position- Face to Face Data Engineer -
Location-  Parsippany, NJ (Onsite)- Local Candidate
Required Skills:
This position requires at least a bachelors degree in Engineering, Computer Science, MIS or equivalent from an accredited institution. A copy of the degree must be submitted with the Candidate Proposal Response.
6 years experience as a Business Analyst working on software enhancements or new application development project(s) gathering and prioritizing business requirements with users and documenting business requirements.
6 years experience with analysis and documentation of complex business rules, workflow processes, and re-engineering business processes.
6 years experience leading meetings and facilitating requirements sessions with business/program subject matter experts including functional requirements, non-functional requirements, and security requirements.
6 years business analysis experience with all phases of application development including requirements analysis, design and development, testing, and maintenance of complex systems and reports.
6 years experience with creating and developing documentation: business requirements, business and system process flows, swim lane diagrams, use cases, user interface mockups, user documentation, and technical specifications.
6 years experience with Visio, Balsamiq, and/or other tools for creating and maintaining process flows and wireframes.
Description:
The Business Analyst will support COVID-19 applications used for preparedness response in emergencies. The incumbent will conduct business analysis activities for various Emergency Preparedness applications undergoing updates with primary focus on Countermeasure Data Management System (CDMS) used for COVID-19 rapid test scheduling and COVID-19 vaccine administration, but also other relevant applications including Incident Management System Dashboard, Medical Emergency Response Inventory Tracking and other grant-related applications as needed.

Workday Learning Consultant
Location: Remote / Fremont, CA
Roles & Responsivities
Job Overview:
Workday Learning Consultant will work directly with internal stakeholders to develop, deploy, and support learning campaigns and associated reports to ensure company
compliance.
Experience:
6+ years of experience with Workday Learning and core HCM
Experience with Workday Custom Report writing (Advanced, Matrix, Composite, RaaS, etc.) including the development of complex calculated fields
Preferred experience with Workday PRISM
Workday Learning Certification
Job Description:
Set up and maintain the Workday Learning module, including creating and managing learning content (courses, lessons, programs), scheduling learning campaigns, and
managing user access.
Stay up to date on new features in Workday Learning, including biannual releases.
Develop test cases for Workday Learning updates, upgrades, and enhancements, as well as troubleshooting user issues and system errors.
Partner with the HRIS team on system integrations with third party content providers.
Providing support to users on the Workday Learning module, including training materials, documentation, and troubleshooting assistance.
Manage learning data within Workday, ensuring data accuracy and generating reports to track learning progress and effectiveness.
Monitor assignment, enrolment and completion of compliance courses for new joiners as well as annual learners.
Ensure data privacy and integrity at all times.
Skills / Knowledge:
Strong knowledge of the Workday Learning module, including its configuration, functionality, and best practices
Solid understanding of HR systems, functions, processes, and advanced reporting environments
Strong experience in iloads, EIBs and Core Connectors
Analytical skills and ability to synthesize change quickly using subject and process knowledge.
Independent problem solving  ability to articulate issues across projects and the business.
Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Experience:
6+ years of experience with Workday Learning and core HCM
Experience with Workday Custom Report writing (Advanced, Matrix, Composite, RaaS, etc.) including the development of complex calculated fields
Preferred experience with Workday PRISM
Workday Learning Certification

Looking for : Sr. Network Engineer || Tallahassee, FL (Onsite) at Tallahassee, Florida, USA
Email:
[email protected]
http://bit.ly/4ey8w48

Hello,
Hope you are doing well.
Please find the below JD and share your candidate profile.
Job Tittle: Sr. Network Engineer
Location: : Tallahassee, FL (Onsite)
Duration: 12+ Month Contract
Looking for local candidate of Florida Only.
Need USC, GC, GC EAD & H4EAD candidates Only.
Should have CCIE Enterprise or CCNP Enterprise Certifications (Required)
Job Description
Knowledge to identify measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.
Knowledge of Cisco LAN and Routing equipment; Knowledge of Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2012-2022 and client software used to support a LAN/WAN environment.
Knowledge of Mainframe Emulation Tools; Knowledge of PC based software; Strong knowledge of Local Area Networks (LAN), DHCP, DNS, TCP/IP, SSL, VPN and routing protocols; Strong
network troubleshooting skills.
Strong knowledge in developing upgrade and implementation plans and working with project team members and management to implement changes.
Ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions.
Ability to communicate effectively with peers, supervisors and customers, verbally and in writing.
Ability to follow established policies and procedures.
Ability to analyze information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast paced, high velocity, environment; ability to stay focused on responsibilities, meet deadlines and manage competing
priorities under pressure.
Ability to drive effective meetings: workshops, design, and problem-solving sessions.
Ability to present ideas in business friendly and user-friendly language; demonstrated aptitude for working with, supporting and communicating with users and customers.
Ability to write, maintain, and interpret python scripts
Ability to write and maintain documentation on existing and new processes.
Ability to configure and maintain Cisco Meraki appliances and dashboards.
Programming Languages: Python (Highly Suggested)
General Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs)
1. Communication: Have the ability to clearly convey information, in both written and verbal formats, to individuals or groups in a wide variety of settings (i.e.; project
team meetings, management presentations, etc.). Must have the ability to effectively listen and process information provided by others.
2. Customer Service: Works well with clients and customers (i.e.; business office, public, or other agencies). Able to assess the needs of the customer, provide information
or assistance to satisfy expectations or resolve a problem.
3. Decision Making: Makes sound, well-informed, and objective decisions.
4. Flexibility: Is open to change, new processes (or process improvement), and new information. Has the ability to adapt in response to new information, changing conditions,
or unexpected obstacles. Ability to receive and give constructive criticism and maintain effective work relationships with others.
5. Interpersonal: Shows friendliness, courtesy, understanding, and politeness to others.
6. Leadership: Motivates, encourages, and challenges others. Can adapt leadership styles in a variety of situations.
7. Problem Solving: Able to identify, evaluate, and use sound judgement to generate and evaluate alternative actions, and make recommendations as accordingly.
8. Team Building: Encourages, inspires, and guides others toward accomplishing the common goal.
Thanks & Regards,
Krishna Chaudhary

Contract job role for Full Stack .Net Developer at New York, NY(Hybrid) at New York, New York, USA
Email:

http://bit.ly/4ey8w48
https://jobs.nvoids.com/job_details.jsp?id=2937242&uid=59461dec57634be4a0c5e2e761aa706d
Hi,
Hope you are doing well!
My name is
Vinod Dixit, and I work for
Tanisha Systems Inc.
Tanisha Systems Inc.
is a leading
provider of Custom Application Development and end-to-end IT Services to our clients globally.
Our clients include
IBM, Cap Gemini, ATOS, Kyndryl, Cognizant, etc., to name a few.
Job Title: Full Stack .Net Developer
Location: New York, NY(Hybrid)
Duration: Long term
Interview Mode:
in-person(F2F)
Job Description:
The Valuation IT team is building a platform for the Valuation and Asset Management teams for the daily, monthly, and quarterly marking of all Credit investments.
This new platform will connect with multiple pricing sources to obtain marks, apply pricing rules, track the approval workflow, and integrate with various downstream applications
for further processing and reporting. We are seeking an experienced full stack developer who is excited to join our team to design, develop, and maintain a new, highly interactive, data-driven web application.
The Valuation IT Full Stack Developer will join our custom application developer team as a full stack developer, with opportunity in the future to grow into a senior architect
and managerial role.
This is a unique opportunity to build a new platform, from the ground up.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES DEVELOPMENT & ARCHITECTURE
Develop a deep understanding of the business process complexity, then creatively design and build a platform to match these needs. Work with business stakeholders to understand
their requirements and proactively ask questions.
Design cloud-native applications using microservices, function apps, and cloud databases, primarily on the Microsoft tech stack.
Implement responsive and scalable UI components using Angular (Typescript), DevExpress, AG Grid, Bootstrap, JQuery, and similar frameworks .
Optimize application performance, ensuring fast load times and smooth interactions.
Ensure cross-browser compatibility and accessibility standards compliance .
Build reusable components and contribute to frontend architecture decisions.
Work closely with UX designer/frontend developers to ensure application aligns to design standards .
Work closely with full stack/backend developers to integrate APIs and ensure efficient data communication and application logic .
Collaborate with the broader development team to improve best practices and participate in code reviews.
Build and debug applications full stack applications using C#, .NET, SQL Server, Angular, and Azure services, digging into issues to discover root causes .
Implement backend testing frameworks like NUnit, XUnit, Moq etc. for unit testing application modules.
Implement frontend testing frameworks like Jasmine and Karma for Frontend- applications
Learn clients business processes and IT best practices, with the opportunity to grow into the role of senior architect and manage a team of developers
PROJECT & TEAM MANAGEMENT
Ensure high code quality through unit testing and QA collaboration.
Design and oversee automated testing strategies (unit, integration) for valuation platform components to ensure reliability and accelerate release cycles .
Stay organized by updating the Azure Boards ticketing system and track status updates for our deliverables CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT & COMMUNICATION .
Establish and maintain effective relationships with business and technology partners .
Proactively ask questions about the requirements or business needs .
Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices .
Continuously seek opportunities to improve our processes and tools .
Support data governance initiatives by defining policies, standards, and best practices.
QUALIFICATIONS EDUCATION
Bachelors degree in computer science, Data Science, Finance, or other relevant field.
Masters degree is a plus EXPERIENCE
Minimum of 8 years of experience
Expertise in designing and building cloud native applications (microservices, function apps, and cloud databases, primarily on the Microsoft tech stack)
Expertise in .Net technology stack (.Net framework, .Net core, ASP.net, C#, ADO.Net, Linq, Entity Framework, Dapper)
Expertise in building services REST / SOAP
Expertise in database design and development with SQL server (DDL, DML commands, tables, views, stored procedures, functions, indexes, Dynamic SQL), handling huge data, performance
optimization, and debugging techniques
Experience managing global teams
Experience with writing business logic with optimal performance approach in C# and SQL
Experience building custom, net new solutions from the ground up
Experience working with modern frontend frameworks such as Angular, DevExpress, AG Grid, and other UI component libraries
Strong understanding of integration services, reporting platforms, and workflow platforms
Familiarity with performance optimization techniques for data-heavy applications
Azure Services Expertise o Hands-on experience with Azure App Services (Web Apps), Azure Functions, Azure Service Bus / Event Grid / Event Hub for message queuing and event-driven
architecture o Familiarity with Azure Storage (Blob, Queue, Table) and Azure Key Vault for secure secrets management o Experience with Azure API Management for securing and managing APIs
Security & Compliance o Implement Azure AD authentication, OAuth2, OpenID Connect, and role-based access control (RBAC) o Familiarity with Azure Monitor, Application Insights,
and Log Analytics for observability and troubleshooting
Scalability & Performance o Experience with auto-scaling, load balancing, and performance tuning in Azure environments o Knowledge of Azure Front Door or Azure CDN for global
distribution and performance optimization
Messaging & Event-Driven Architecture o Deep understanding of Azure Service Bus, Event Grid, and Event Hub for asynchronous communication and microservices orchestration
Well-versed in project management and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies and best practices TECHNICAL SKILLS
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure, ASP.NET Core, and .NET-based backend services
Web Technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, Bootstrap, AJAX, XML /JSON, REST API
JavaScript Libraries / Frameworks: Angular, , D3.js, RxJS, jQuery
IDEs: Visual Studio Code, Microsoft Visual Studio
Database: Cosmos DB, Microsoft SQL Server
Version Control: GIT, CI/CD pipelines
Familiar with Azure DevOps/Boards and Agile development methodologies like Scrum and Extreme Programming
DOMAIN KNOWLEDGE
Relevant experience in the finance domain, at an asset management firm is a huge plus
Base understanding of core data (assets, positions, trades, funds, marks) is a huge plus SOFT SKILLS
Excited to design and build a new application
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong, proactive communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work
Thanks & Regards

Hi,
Greetings from Smart IT Frame!!
I have an excellent opportunity for you with one of our direct clients. If you are interested in looking for a new opportunity please respond to my email ASAP.
Don't share GC profile..
Note: Need only local candidates from MA/ MN,
Role: DevOps Engineer with Kubernetes Experience
Location: Boston, MA or Minneapolis, MN (Onsite),
Experience: 10 to 15+ Yrs,
Candidate should be strong in Kubernetes and Cluster management. There will be a HackerRank test as part of the client evaluation.
The ideal candidate will have strong hands-on experience with Kubernetes (preferably EKS), AWS services, and automation tools.
Key Responsibilities
Deploy, manage, and optimize Kubernetes clusters in production environments, preferably using Amazon EKS.
Design and implement Infrastructure-as-Code using Terraform to automate cloud resource provisioning.
Develop and maintain automation scripts using Python to support deployment and operational tasks.
Work with AWS core services (e.g., EC2, S3, IAM, VPC, CloudWatch) to build and maintain scalable cloud environments.
Build and manage CI/CD pipelines for containerized applications, ensuring efficient and reliable deployment workflows.
Collaborate with development teams to support application architecture (Java and/or Python).
Monitor system performance and reliability using observability tools such as Datadog or Dynatrace.
Ensure security, compliance, and best practices across cloud and container environments.
Required Qualifications
Proven experience with Kubernetes in production environments (EKS preferred).
Strong knowledge of AWS infrastructure and services.
Proficiency in Python scripting and Terraform.
Experience with CI/CD systems and container build/deploy workflows.
Familiarity with application architecture (Java and/or Python).
Exposure to observability tools like Datadog, Dynatrace, or similar.
